result.execSummary:
The defendant Rey D Mendoza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample; pay DNA surcharge. Pay all costs and surcharges by 07-06-16. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rey D Mendoza

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Court sentences defendant to serve 5 days in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

Court ordered cash bail on deposit to be applied towards costs and surcharges.

Court ordered defendant to pay all costs and surcharges by 7/6/2016. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant Rey D Mendoza in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Defendant Rey D Mendoza in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Angel Lee Johnson in court, defendant Rey D Mendoza not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing. For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rey D Mendoza in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel has received discovery. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 31.  All parties are notified that effective 12-1-15 this case will be assigned to Reserve Branch, Branch 31, in Room 615 of the Courthouse. 
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT AND DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Rey D Mendoza in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Defendant Rey D Mendoza in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin. LM   
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dee, Br. 37.  
  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07/17/2015
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Rey D Mendoza not in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7/21/15 @ 1:30 pm
